alert.note: Alert for Langlade; Lincoln (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 31 at 10:06AM CDT until April 01 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...MAJOR STORM SYSTEM TO BRING WIDESPREAD WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO THE AREA TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY... .A strong low pressure system over eastern Nebraska will track to central Lake Michigan by early Saturday morning. The storm will bring a wide array of weather to the area, including a couple rounds of significant wintry precipitation. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches and ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Langlade and Lincoln Counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM CDT this evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible tonight. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If traveling, consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded. Be sure your vehicle has sufficient fuel before crossing open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
